status_message: Secret documents reveal that the Government is willing to sacrifice the environment for trade deals. Terrifying - but we'll fight it.

status_message: Today we've launched our local elections campaign and are excited to announce that we've fielded a record number of candidates - hundreds more than UKIP! Everywhere, Greens are making a meaningful difference in communities and with over 1,500 candidates you can elect many more this May.

Last night Jonathan Bartley spoke on BBC Question Time about the crisis in Syria - the need to freeze assets of those with blood on their hands, end arms sales to the Middle East, and take in more refugees.

This morning, we woke to news Donald Trump has launched air strikes against a Syrian airbase. There is no simple answer to this crisis, and President Trump's actions risk exacerbating an already complex situation – particularly in the absence of any coherent strategy to build peace. If our ultimate goal is to protect people – and it should be – we must step up soft and hard diplomacy. We need to send a strong signal to Assad that his actions are intolerable whilst at the same time avoid any escalation of violence that puts more civilian lives at risk.

Read our co-leaders' full statement here: https://www.greenparty.org.uk/news/2017/04/07/green-party-statement-on-us-airstrikes-in-syria/

Tonight on BBC Question Time, Jonathan Bartley was the only panelist to stand up for freedom of movement and the environment. He called out Theresa May's Brexit for what it is - a right wing coup. And he challenged the Government for its despicable cuts to support for sick and disabled people.

Brexit threatens our environment. But Greens will protect it. At Conference, our members decided that we'll campaign for a new Environmental Protection Act - and across the country Greens are taking action to protect our communities. Help us continute that work ↓ greenparty.org.uk/climateresponsibility

At our Spring Conference we set out our vision for an economy fit for the 21st century. And that means big, bold ideas. One of them is a 3 day weekend. 

The time for revolutionary ideas is now. And it's time to ask what - and most importantly who - the economy is meant to serve.

status_message: What a Conference! Thank you to everyone who came - a new kind of politics is possible because of you.  And to everyone standing with with us - you do all this ↓ and we will win 💚
"We need take a step back and think: what is the purpose of the economy, what kind of country do we want to be, and do we really want a future where all of us are just trying to work even harder?"

status_message: Wish you had tomorrow off? Us too. Watch Caroline Lucas explain why we're exploring the idea of a three day weekend.

We have a message for young people from Green Party Conference. We know you've been let down by Brexit. But we have a vision for a positive future.

We'll fight for your right to move for work, travel and study. We'll fight for tax justice to protect public services. And we'll fight to preserve our environment for generations to come.

If you want a Party interested in moving forwards, not turning the clock back, join us >>> join.greenparty.org.uk
We need a strong, robust voice on the left. We need bold, radical ideas for the 21st century. And we need to wipe the smile off Nigel Farage's face. Only the Green Party can do all of this.

status_message: Imagine 25 of Caroline Lucas in Parliament! Our members took a brave decision today 💚  What do you think of it?

Our environment is threatened by leaving the EU. That's why Greens just voted unanimously to campaign for a new Environmental Protection Act, making sure that our natural world is safeguarded for generations to come. Does Brexit make you worry about the environment too?
We're live from our Spring Conference in Liverpool with our deputy leader Amelia Womack!
"In the face of Trump and Brexit, terror, wars and environmental crises, it's easy to feel powerless but that's what the establishment wants. They want us to give up hope. But we won't" 💚

With Theresa May set to trigger Article 50 on the 29th March, we need to send a clear message to Government that we reject their vision for an extreme Brexit.

Could Britain's Greens experience the same surge as GroenLinks in the Netherlands? That's the question Molly Scott Cato MEP has taken on in The Guardian today.

"The political landscape is going through a period of seismic change. Broadly speaking, it is young people who embrace the reality of the global village and recognise their place as citizens of a world they share and need to protect," she writes.

"As climate change and other trans-border issues dominate the politics of the 21st century, we may see more elections where the far-right populists and Greens are vying for the votes of those jaded with the right and left choice of the last century."

status_message: We can't treat people like bargaining chips. And if taking back control means anything, it means a vote on the future of our country. Our co-leader Caroline Lucas won't budge from her principles in tonight's critical #BrexitBill vote. Who's with her?
Every day, Greens show that politics can be a force for good. Our co-leaders are standing up for a different kind of politics – in Parliament, in the media and on the streets.

Halfway there! A determined team of Greens are currently walking  from a fracking site in Yorkshire to one in Lancashire. The 120-mile protest walk highlights the harm fracking brings to local communities - and the clean alternatives the Government must commit to.

Keep up with their progress and find more on nofrackingway.info - and give them a comment of support below! #NoFrackingWayUK
Nothing on climate change. Nothing on green energy. Nothing on air pollution. A colossal wasted opportunity.

status_message: In the Autumn Statement we reminded the Chancellor that he forgot to mention the words 'climate change'. But it seems we have to remind him again. Not a single mention in his statement today - and nothing to adress the air pollution emergency.
The Chancellor has delivered his budget and it utterly fails to address the challenges of our time. But we'll keep on fighting!

Ahead of today's Spring Budget, here's what the Government would rather we didn't tell you. For too long now the economy in this country has worked for those at the top, while failing everyone else. We need an emergency intervention.

This International Women's Day is about being bold for change. We're proud to be a Party full of inspirational members (many more than we could fit here!) who fight for equality every day. Right now much of what we've fought for is at risk. So we'll be bolder than ever – standing up to bullies and advocating for change at every possible opportunity.

Tomorrow the Chancellor announces the Spring Budget and one thing is clear: there must be an emergency intervention to steer Britain away from the brink of multiple crises.

Years of underinvestment means our NHS and social care is at the risk of collapse. Meanwhile big business and top earners get tax cuts. And instead of investing in renewables the Government penalises schools that install solar panels. 

Is that fair? We don't think so. Here's how we would fix tomorrow's budget.
There's no two ways about it: this is a national emergency and it's time for the Government to act.
link_name: Tomorrow the Chancellor could stop 40,000 early deaths. Will he? | Caroline Lucas

status_message:
The NHS is one of our greatest achievements. We cannot allow it to be undermined and ultimately destroyed. 

The Green Party is proud to support this march, called by Health Campaigns Together and the People's Assembly. We believe in a publically funded health system, and we will always campaign against cuts, closures and privatisation.

Join other Greens on Saturday 4 March and send a clear message to this Government.  We'll meet at 11am on the forecourt outside Euston Station (where all the outdoor benches are) and walk down to Tavistock Sq. for 11.30. 

Also, watch out for our health spokesperson Larry Sanders who will be speaking at the rally after the march.

Full details at main event page, including details of transport from around the UK: https://www.facebook.com/events/1771664639725061/

The dodgy trade deal CETA passed in the European Parliament last night. Once ratified it'll mean that corporations can sue Governments if they hinder profit. It's clear that Brexit will not free Britain from toxic trade deals - in fact the UK's trade minister sees CETA as a model for future deals! That's why it's so important we don't let the Government get away with this - and that we don't let the far-right own this issue.

We love democracy -  and we LOVE fair voting systems 💚

With a fair voting system we would get a Parliament that reflects everybody's views. That's right, one simple switch to proportional representation and every vote counts! It's time to fix the UK's democratic deficit. Today our Peer Jenny Jones continues her fight for radical reform, as her House of Lords Bill gets its second reading. We believe that people who make our laws should be democratically elected - not appointed - and her plan is to replace the House of Lords with an elected second chamber.  What do you think of the House of Lords? Should it be reformed? Let us know in the comments!
We aren't a threat to freedom. But comments like this show that we are a threat to the far-right. A threat to climate deniers and oil companies. And a threat to racists, misogynists and bullies.

It's a sad day when we can't count on our own Prime Minister to stand up to fascism. And it's all the more important that we – and millions of us around the world – stand up to it in every single way we can: join.greenparty.org.uk.
Tens of thousands across the UK gathered last night to #StandUpToTrump. Together we sent a strong message to Theresa May that we won't stand for her complicity - or Trump's racist bigotry!

This spring, the Green Party of England and Wales (GPEW) will be hosting the first ever joint Congress between the Global Greens and the European Green Party from Thursday 30 March to Sunday 2 April 2017 at the ACC in Liverpool: #Greens2017. The event will also incorporate our Spring Conference (Friday 31 March - Sunday 2 April) and with a predicted attendance of over 2,000 this will probably be the largest gathering of Greens ever!

Registration and programme
Registering for our conference will also give you access to the joint Congress. As most Congress sessions will be open to members of all parties, we are encouraging GPEW members to attend from Thursday when the official opening will be held. There is no extra cost for this day. 
GPEW members and supporters should register via our website www.greenparty.org.uk.
  
A draft Congress timetable can be found on the http://greens2017.org/ website. The programme will include:
●	Joint plenaries with guest speakers on the topics of 'Fighting for hope: from Paris to 1.5 degrees', 'Green Political Democracy from Grassroots to Government' and 'Fighting Inequality by Empowering People'
●	A packed programme of parallel sessions open to all attendees on a wide variety of topical subjects
●	Facilitated 'Open Space' discussion sessions
●	Joint sessions for diversity groups, eg European Green Seniors meets GPEW Green Seniors
●	Training sessions on eg empowering female politicians 
●	Music from the Fab Beatles and Seize the Day plus film screenings and other entertainment options in the evenings.
●	A full itinerary of 'extra-curricular' options for delegates to book in for, before, during and after Conference - walking tours, excursions, etc

Accommodation
There are plenty of accommodation options in Liverpool and you can find details of them on the conference website. We have reserved 300 rooms at a preferential rate of £65-70 at three Premier Inns in the city. 
https://www.greenparty.org.uk/conference/accommodation-congress.html

Travel
We are offering a liftshare scheme, and if you book your train via the excellent Loco2 website, 1% of the ticket prices is donated to the party! 
https://www.greenparty.org.uk/conference/travel-and-accommodation/getting-to-conference.html

Creche
There will be a creche available for children aged between 1 and 11.  
https://www.greenparty.org.uk/conference/creche.html

We look forward to meeting you in Liverpool at this unique event!
www.greenparty.org.uk/conference
Queries to conference@greenparty.org.uk

We're recruiting a Young Greens/students organiser! This role is all about engaging with young people and students across England and Wales. This is a really exciting opportunity and we're looking for someone who has experience in membership development and support, events, campaigns and communications. Does this sound like you? Then apply!

"Aren't these the actions of someone who doesn't yet have the experience?"
"No, they are the actions of a racist bigot."

Caroline Lucas talking to BBC News about Trump's #MuslimBan.

Our letter in the The Guardian today:

It is mortifying that the prime minister was photographed hand in hand on Holocaust Memorial Day with a US president who, later that day, signed an executive order placing an immediate ban on immigrants from seven Muslim majority countries and all refugees entering the US. These measures are a barbaric attack on Muslims in the US, from the countries which are now banned and on all Muslims around the world, stamping upon all principles of liberty and civil rights and undermining the value system on which all our democracies are based.

As UK Greens we are ashamed that the highest elected official of our country visited the US during this time and then spectacularly failed to take a serious stand against such hatred. We call upon our prime minister to condemn the order in the strongest terms. Half-baked statements simply aren't good enough. All who value human rights must stand up against this alarming act, the rise in hatred it represents and these clear stirrings towards fascism.
link_name: Donald Trump's shameful ban on Muslims and refugees

Today's court ruling was a victory for democracy. We've all been given a new opportunity to put our values at the heart of negotiations to leave the EU.

Almost 10,000 people have signed the petition to keep freedom of movement. Have you? -> action.greenparty.org.uk/freemovement

The Government has lost the Supreme Court case, which means that now MPs must be consulted before triggering Article 50. As a party which stands for environmental, social and economic justice we will not support a Government offering no assurances to EU nationals living in Britain, threatening to turn this country into a tax haven and planning to throw us off the Brexit cliff edge. We also will not support triggering Article 50 without the guaranteee of giving people a further say in a ratification referendum.

status_message: Right now Caroline Lucas is waiting to present her PSHE Bill in Parliament.  PSHE (personal, social, health and economic education) matters more than ever. Here's why.

People are coming together today to say #BridgesNotWalls. Our London Assembly members and our co-leader Jonathan Bartley dropped a banner this morning, and lots of Greens will be doing the same across the UK to show that we stand united against hatred and the rise of the far-right.

Tomorrow Caroline Lucas will present her PSHE Bill to Parliament. The demand for compulsory PSHE is growing week by week and the bill has received support from across the political spectrum. We are calling on MPs to send a clear message tomorrow - rejecting sexism and embracing an education that teaches children self-respect and respect for others. Do you think PSHE should be compulsory, and why?
